de.thkoeln.bibl.api.media

Class AbstractMediaNumber

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.thkoeln.bibl.api.media.AbstractMediaNumber
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<AbstractMediaNumber>

    public abstract class AbstractMediaNumber
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<AbstractMediaNumber>
    Class implements the structure of a media number. Specializing sub-classes must describe the concrete media number with an REGEX and can use the functionality of this class to access the number in an objective way. This class and all sub-classes supports the serializing to/from XML data.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • AbstractMediaNumber

        public AbstractMediaNumber(java.lang.String number,
                           java.util.regex.Pattern pattern,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,AbstractMediaNumber.GroupType> groupDef)
                    throws MediaFormatException
        Initialize a new AbstractMediaNumber with the supplied REGEX pattern and group definition.
        Parameters:
        number - the media number
        pattern - the pattern defining the media number structure
        groupDef - the group definition describing the pattern groups
        Throws:
        MediaFormatException - if the supplied media number could't parsed with the supplied pattern

      • AbstractMediaNumber

                           MediaFormatException
        Initialize a new AbstractMediaNumber with the supplied REGEX String and group definition.
        Parameters:
        number - the media number
        regex - the pattern String defining the media number structure
        groupDef - the group definition describing the pattern groups
        Throws:
        java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException - if the supplied REGEX pattern is invalid
        MediaFormatException - if the supplied media number could't parsed with the supplied pattern

      • AbstractMediaNumber

        public AbstractMediaNumber(java.lang.String number)
                    throws MediaFormatException
        Initialize a new AbstractMediaNumber. The media number pattern and group definition is defined in the specializing sub class.
        Parameters:
        number - the media number
        Throws:
        MediaFormatException - if the supplied media number could't parsed

      • getGroupDefinition

        public abstract java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,AbstractMediaNumber.GroupType> getGroupDefinition()
        Returns the default REGEX group definition. The definition corresponds to the default pattern returned by getDefPattern(). The key defines the group, GroupType the way to interpret the value and the map order the weight of the groups. First element will be compared first and so on.
        Returns:
        the default group definition

      • getPattern

        public abstract java.util.regex.Pattern getPattern()
        Returns the default REGEX pattern. The pattern corresponds to the default group definition returned by getDefGroupDef() and describes the format of the media number.
        Returns:
        the default pattern
